main_definition: Changes or alterations made to something in order to improve it, adapt it, or make it fit specific requirements.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Adjustments to a plan, design, or product to correct problems or enhance functionality
meanings_and_examples.example: The modifications made to the original blueprint of the house included changing the size and position of the windows.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Changes in behavior or appearance over time
meanings_and_examples.example: As I grew older, my physical modifications became more noticeable, such as gaining weight and losing height.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Alterations to a system or process for better performance or efficiency
meanings_and_examples.example: The company implemented software modifications to enhance the data processing speed of their computers.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Revisions made in written work, such as essays and reports, to improve clarity or correct errors
meanings_and_examples.example: Before submitting his research paper, John carefully reviewed all modifications for grammatical errors and unclear sentences.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Changes made to a product's design or features after its initial release to meet new market demands or technological advancements
meanings_and_examples.example: The latest smartphone model includes several modifications, such as an improved camera and faster processing speed, compared to its predecessor.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Amendments made to laws or regulations to reflect societal changes or address new challenges
meanings_and_examples.example: After public outcry, the government passed modifications to labor laws to ensure better working conditions for employees.
